comments.body: This could be expanded to a more complete example that includes an initial Daml script to create an example history and then display the resulting Daml script exports for different configurations. This could be imported via `literalinclude` from a working example similar to how other documentation chapters do, to make sure that the documentation stays up-to-date and correct. However, this requires a bit more work, so I'll leave that for a separate PR.

The ``--party`` flags define which contracts will be included in the export. In
the above example only contracts visible to the parties Alice and Bob will be
included in the export. Lack of visibility of certain events may cause exports to fail, see :ref:`caveats <export-caveats>`.

comments.body: (not for this PR) We probably need to check what we do if the directory already exists or if it is not empty. Probably best to fail with a good error by default and maybe have a --force flag.

Yes, currently overwriting fails with
```
java.nio.file.FileAlreadyExistsException: ../dump-out/deps
```
We should handle this properly, produce a good error message. `--force` sounds useful too.

comments.body: Side note: There is no nice mapping from old party ids to new party ids atm. One solution for that would be to accept a TextMap instead of a record as an argument with the keys being the old party ids.
Indeed, I've raised a ticket for this: https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/issues/9453
